intro: Hieracium lachenalii subsp. chrysoglossoides, commonly known as the golden-leafed hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellowish-green leaves and small, clustered flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its unique leaf morphology and the coloration of its inflorescence. It typically grows in moist, calcareous soils in meadows and woodland edges. This plant is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements.
